info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 5 at 2:29PM CDT until July 6 at 5:52AM CDT by NWS Austin/San Antonio TX
info.description:
...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Texas...
Guadalupe River At NB Below Comal affecting Comal and Guadalupe Counties.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Guadalupe River at NB Below Comal.
* WHEN...From this afternoon to late tonight.
* IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Moderate flooding threatens lowest homes in the Guadalupe river flood plain. Secondary roads, streets, and low bridges are flooded and dangerous. River Road above New Braunfels is widely flooded and very dangerous to motorists and campers.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 13.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 13.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:00 PM CDT Saturday was 13.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage late this afternoon to 9.8 feet late tomorrow morning. It will then rise to 10.1 feet tomorrow afternoon. It will fall to 9.5 feet Wednesday evening then rise again. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.4 feet on 10/14/2021. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
To escape rising water, take the shortest path to higher ground.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued Sunday morning by 600 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE TONIGHT
